items.title: EU warns Google: Gemini cannot be the only AI with deep Android integration (Updated: Statement)
items.summary: New DMA proceedings focus on giving rival AI services equal and effective access to the Android platform.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR The European Commission has opened DMA proceedings against Google to ensure third-party AI services have equal access to Android features used by Gemini. Google must also provide rival search engines and AI chatbots with access to anonymized ranking, query, and click data to foster fair competition. The Commission will issue preliminary findings within three months, along with a draft of the measures it intends to impose on Google to comply with the DMA. Update: January 27, 2026 (11:03 PM ET): Googleâ€™s Senior Competition Counsel, Clare Kelly, shared the following statement on the matter with Android Authority : Android is open by design, and weâ€™re already licensing Search data to competitors under the DMA. However, we are concerned that further rules which are often driven by competitor grievances rather than the interest of consumers, will compromise user privacy, security, and innovation .

items.title: APRA Preps â€˜Significant Celebrationâ€™ For 100thÂ Anniversary
items.summary: Those centenary plans include the launch of a new â€œhall of fame-styleâ€ event in November, along with the â€œbiggest everâ€ APRA Music Awards in Sydney in April.
items.body: SYDNEY, Australia — APRA will celebrate its 100 th anniversary with a bang. Announced today, Jan. 28, the Australasian Performing Right Association inks a full slate of centenary activities to the calendar, for what the PRO describes as the â€œmost significant celebration of the contribution of songwriting and composition to Australia and New Zealand’s culture, identity and economy.â€ Those plans include the launch of a new â€œhall of fame-styleâ€ event in November, along with the â€œbiggest everâ€ APRA Music Awards in Sydney in April and Silver Scroll Awards/Kaitito Kaiaka in New Zealand this October. Also, the SongHubs  collaborative songwriting program will get a boost in Australia in April and New Zealand in September, and a major anthology book will be published, recognizing 100 years of music from these parts. The action gets underway with a digital history timeline, dubbed APRA: A Century of Song , a teasers of which can be seen here . The spotlight will fall on such moments as Johnny Oâ€™Keefeâ€™s â€œWild One,â€ which Iggy Pop famously interpolated in 1986â€™s â€œReal Wild Child (Wild One);â€ the global success of AC/â€¦

items.title: Samsung is no longer being subtle about its next big display trick
items.summary: Samsung's new pixel-level privacy display one-ups traditional privacy screen protectors with customizable settings.
items.body: Credit: Samsung TL;DR Samsung has detailed a new privacy layer coming to Galaxy phones, confirming the previously leaked Privacy Display feature expected to debut in the Galaxy S26 series. The company has revealed that its solution is not just an always-on filter, but a pixel-level solution that can be customized to fit the userâ€™s needs. Galaxy users will be able to apply the new privacy protection only to specific apps, automatically shield PINs and other sensitive inputs, limit whatâ€™s visible in notification pop-ups, and more. After several leaks and a previous slip-up inside One UI, Samsung has now officially detailed what it calls â€œa new Galaxy privacy layer,â€ and it lines up almost perfectly with the rumored Privacy Display feature for the Galaxy S26 series .

items.title: Pusha T Sends Message to Late Grandma After Clipse â€˜Jeopardy!â€™ Clue: â€˜Hope You Were Watching & PlayingÂ Alongâ€™
items.summary: "Hey Shank (my grandmother in heaven) we made it!!!"
items.body: You know you’ve made it when you’re a clue on Jeopardy! — and that’s especially true for Pusha T , who shared a sweet message on Tuesday (Jan. 27) about growing up watching the classic game show with his late grandma. On Tuesday’s Tournament of Champions episode, a clue about Clipse — Pusha’s rap duo with brother Malice — came up in the category “It Happened in 2025.” Related Clipse Reflect on Historic Vatican Performance: ‘Hip-Hop Belongs Everywhere’ Why Clipse and Pharrell Want A Grammy For Acclaimed New Album: ‘You Don’t Play The Game Just To Get A Participation Trophy’ Billboard Staffâ€™s Greatest Pop Stars of 2025: Comeback Artist of the Year â€” Clipse “In 2025, Clipse gave the first-ever rap performance in this city-state during the ‘Grace for the World’ concert,” host Ken Jennings read, with two wrong answers (Monaco and San Marino) coming before Scott answered correctly. “What is the Vatican?” “Even less rapping the Vatican,” Jennings quipped. Pusha celebrated the mention by sharing a message to his Jeopardy! -loving late grandmother. â€¦

items.title: Madison Beerâ€™s â€˜Locketâ€™ Makes Top 10 Debut on 5 Billboard AlbumÂ Charts
items.summary: Among its debuts are first-ever top 10s on the Billboard 200 & Top Album Sales.
items.body: Madison Beer â€™s new studio album, Locket , makes a top 10 debut across five Billboard album charts (dated Jan. 31). She achieves career-first top 10s on the Billboard 200 (No. 10), Indie Store Album Sales (No. 2), Top Current Album Sales (No. 4) and Top Album Sales (No. 4), while also scoring her second top 10 on Vinyl Albums (No. 3). Related A$AP Rockyâ€™s â€˜Donâ€™t Be Dumbâ€™ Debuts at No. 1 on Billboard 200 Madison Beer’s Locket Tour Dates for North America & Europe Revealed: ‘Can’t Believe This Is Real’ Hoodoo Gurus Condemn Far-Right Australian Party One Nation Over Use of Their Music In the tracking week ending Jan. 22, Locket earned 43,000 equivalent album units (Beerâ€™s best week by units earned) in the United States according to Luminate. Of that sum, album sales comprise 24,000 (her biggest sales week ever) with 15,000 of that in vinyl purchases (her best week on vinyl); streaming-equivalent album units comprise 18,000 (equaling 18.89 million on-demand official streams of the setâ€™s tracks â€” her best streaming week ever); and track-equivalent album units comprise a negligible sum. Locket is among the six albums that either debut or reenter theâ€¦

items.title: 7 More Dance Songs Youâ€™ll Love If You Have Harry Stylesâ€™ â€˜Apertureâ€™ onÂ Repeat
items.summary: Whet your appetite for Kiss All the Time. Disco, Occasionally with these dance singles that share "Aperture" DNA.
items.body: It tracks that not too long after a photo of Harry Styles standing outside Berlin clubbing institution Berghain with a crew including ZoÃ« Kravitz and German techno producer Ben Klock surfaced online, he announced that he’s releasing what certainly sounds like it’s going to be at least partially a dance album, Kiss All the Time. Disco, Occasionally . Further evidence that the disco might be more than occasional during this album cycle was presented on Jan. 22, when Styles announced his Together, Together tour, which will present a total of 50 shows via residencies in seven cities, with dance/electronic acts Jamie xx , Robyn and Fcukers supporting Styles in New York, Amsterdam and SÃ£o Paulo, respectively. Other openers on this run include Styles’ pal Shania Twain in London, Jorja Smith in Mexico City, FousheÃ© in Melbourne and Skye Newman in Sydney. On Tuesday (Jan. 27), Styles also announced additional dates in Amsterdam and London, with this expansion making him the solo artist with the most shows ever at Londonâ€™s Wembley Stadium in the same calendar year. And of course, the album’s first single “Aperture” certainly leans hard in a dance directioâ€¦

items.body: Hours before turning 41 years old, J. Cole released a four-pack of new freestyles hosted by DJ Clue on Tuesday (Jan. 27). Packaged as the Birthday Blizzard ’26 , the EP is available on Cole’s website for as little as $1. Related J. Cole Tells Life Story in Reverse in New Song & Video ‘Disc 2 Track 2’ J. items.title: Conan Gray Signs With Brandon Creedâ€™s Good WorldÂ Management
items.summary: The pop singer released his fourth album, Wishbone, last year.
items.body: Conan Gray has signed with Brandon Creed ‘s Good World Management. The pop singer joins a superstar roster that includes Charli xcx, Troye Sivan, Ariana Grande, Demi Lovato, Mark Ronson and most recently Role Model. The news was first reported by HITS . Related Managers To Watch: The Execs Helping Chappell Roan, Olivia Dean, Geese & More INXS, AC/DC, GANGgajang Lead Triple M's Most Played Songs in Network History Maya J'an Signs With Warner Records: Debut Single is a Powerful 'Love Letter' to Hometown After L.A. Fires Gray was previously managed by Colette Patnaude Nelson and Eddie Wintle of Expand Entertainment. The pair discovered Gray as a high schooler on YouTube. He signed a record deal with Republic in 2018. Since then, he has grown into a chart-topping pop artist. He released his debut album, Kid Krow , in 2020, which spawned breakout hits “Heather” and “Maniac.” He worked on the project with super producer Dan Nigro (also known for collaborating with Conan’s close friend Olivia Rodrigo ) who remains the go-to songwriter and producer partner for Gray today. More music followed in 2022 ( Superache ) and 2024 ( â€¦

items.title: Fans Can Already Shop Bad Bunnyâ€™s NFL â€œConchoâ€ Merch Ahead of His Super Bowl HalftimeÂ Show
items.summary: The first of two releases features a collection of hats, hoodies, tees and plushies for all 32 NFL teams.
items.body: All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. Super Bowl LX may not be for another couple weeks, but fans of Bad Bunny and the NFL can start celebrating football’s big night with a new merch collection. In collaboration with Ceremony of Roses, the Latin star and the NFL have released the Fans/Concho collection featuring a wide array of hats, hoodies, tees and plushies. Adorned with Benito’s toad mascot, Concho, fans can celebrate the Seattle Seahawks, New England Patriots and the other 30 NFL teams in style. Both the hoodies and t-shirts include a front logo of Concho in full uniform and holding a football, each team’s main logo on the back and a small “Bad Bunny 2026” football logo on the sleeve. The New Era hats take a similar design approach with Concho appearing on the side of the cap and the team logo front and center. Lastly, Bad Bunny is jumping in on the rising bag charm and Labubu trend with a collection of Concho plushies. These seven-inch-tall stuffed toâ€¦

items.title: ROSÃ‰ Says Her Grammy Nods Feel Similar to This Big BLACKPINK Moment on â€˜Call Her Daddyâ€™:Â Watch
items.summary: The K-pop superstar is set to appear on Alex Cooper's podcast.
items.body: Everything’s coming up rosy for ROSÃ‰ ! Alex Cooper’s Call Her Daddy announced on Tuesday (Jan. 27) that the BLACKPINK singer is set to appear in a special episode of the podcast airing the next day, and Billboard has exclusive clip from the interview. Related RosÃ© and Bruno Mars Spill Secrets Behind The Making of ‘APT.,’ 2025’s Biggest Global Hit ROSÃ‰ Reflects on Success of ‘APT.’ on Billboard No. 1s Livestream: ‘Never in a Million Years Would I Have Thought That This Would Happen’ ROSÃ‰ Shares Nail-Biting Moment Leading Up to Historic Grammy Nomination: ‘Are We Not Gonna Get It?’ In a clip from the chat debuting on Billboard , Cooper asks ROSÃ‰ how it feels to receive three 2026 Grammy nominations . (The singer is up for record of the year, song of the year and best pop/duo performance, all for her Bruno Mars collab “APT.”; the nods make her the first K-pop singer to nab nominations in the general field categories.) “That’s a big question!” the pop star laughed in response. She then went on to compare learning about her nods to a massive career moment involving BLACKPINK. â€¦

items.title: Doja Catâ€™s Tour Ma Vie 2026: How to Get Affordable TicketsÂ Online
items.summary: The pop star goes on the road â€” tour dates throughout the U.S. start Thursday, Oct. 1.
items.body: All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. In 2026, Doja Cat goes on the Tour Ma Vie world tour starting in South America, Latin America and Europe before coming back to the United States for the rest of the tour. In fact, the pop star has 28 dates throughout the U.S. starting at Little Caesars Arena in Detroit, Michigan on Thursday, Oct. 1. Although singer Sailorr is supporting Doja Cat during the first half of her tour, it hasn’t been announced who would open for her in the United States. Tickets to the tour first went on sale through Live Nation and Ticketmaster , while the retailer’s Face Value Exchange program is an option for fans to resell tickets. Shop Doja Cat Tickets at Ticketmaster However, many of the dates have either sold out, or are very close to selling out, so one of the best ways to find Doja Cat tickets online is through third-party sites, including StubHub , Vivid Seats , SeatGeek and others — all of which guarantee authentic tickets in time for theâ€¦

items.title: Nova Launcher users are experiencing major bugs following ownership change
items.summary: Nova Launcher is finally getting updates again, but they're coming with major bugs and an uncertain future.
items.body: TL;DR Nova Launcherâ€™s recent updates lay the foundation for an ad-supported free tier â€” and add unfortunate bugs. App users on Reddit are reporting multiple issues that cause the launcher to crash during the setup process and hide their app icons. The latest Nova Launcher build is version 8.2.8, now rolling out across the beta and stable release channels. Nova Launcher, the popular Android launcher thought to have shut down in September 2025 , is officially back, but with a twist. The app started receiving regular updates in November ahead of an ownership change this month. Branch Metrics sold Nova Launcher to the Swedish company Instabridge, which quickly began laying the groundwork for in-app advertisements . Now, the recent updates to Nova Launcher appear to have broken the app, with users on Reddit reporting critical bugs and crashes. The most recent Nova Launcher beta build, version 8.2.8, started reaching users a few days ago. The latest version 8.2.8 is also rolling out across the stable channel as of Saturday, January 24, according to the appâ€™s Google Play Store listing . Since the updateâ€™s release, multiple Reddit users ( 1 , 2 ) are experiencing crashes immediately afterâ€¦

items.title: The GAA Social meets All-Ireland winner Danny Quinn
items.summary: Danny Quinn, an All-Ireland winner with Derry in 1993, opens up on the untimely passing of his wife 15 years ago.

items.title: Donâ€™t scan another unknown QR code without running it by this threat detector
items.summary: McAfee upgrades Scam Detector to catch QR code and messaging scams in real time.
items.body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority TL;DR McAfeeâ€™s latest Scam Detector update focuses on stopping scams before you click, scan, or reply. Real-time QR code scanning is a major upgrade, helping users avoid fake login pages and malware-filled sites instantly. Improved social message analysis makes it easier to catch scams that look like normal conversations. Online scams keep getting more advanced and harder to notice. Scammers use tricks like fake QR codes on restaurant tables and urgent messages from hacked social accounts to blend in with daily digital life. McAfee wants to tackle this growing problem with a new update to its Scam Detector service. McAfee just announced big improvements to its Scam Detector tool, like instant QR code scam checks and better protection for social messaging apps. Now, instead of only reacting after a scam happens, the software helps right when youâ€™re about to click, scan, or reply. If youâ€™ve ever paused before clicking a strange link or scanning a code in public, this update is meant for you.

items.title: Nothing says itâ€™s planning a retail location in NYC
items.summary: Beats joining the Beta Program.
items.body: TL;DR Nothing is opening a second retail location on February 14, in Bengaluru, India. In its announcement for the Bengaluru location, Nothing shared its plans to open stores in New York and Tokyo, as well. Nothing currently operates a single retail location in London. Nothing is planning to open a store in the United States. The companyâ€™s already got a store in London and is opening another soon in Bengaluru, India â€” and itâ€™s also teasing two more: one in New York and one in Tokyo. In a post today on the Nothing Community forum, Nothing announced that itâ€™s opening up a second retail location, in Bengaluru, on Valentineâ€™s Day. The post doesnâ€™t include much info about its future plans, telling fans to â€œStay tuned.â€

items.title: Razerâ€™s new web tool removes the worst part about owning PC peripherals
items.summary: You can now configure your Razer keyboard without installing bulky apps.
items.body: TL;DR Razer supports hardware configuration through its Synapse utility for PC and Mac. If youâ€™d rather not install software, you can now access Synapse over the web. The Synapse web beta is getting started with Huntsman V3 keyboard support. One day, our phones may fully replace our PCs , but until we make that leap, a lot of us are still investing big in our PC rigs. Whether youâ€™ve got a multi-monitor setup built around productivity, a chill workspace accented with RGB lighting, or a ton of high-performance accessories for competitive gaming, the right hardware can add a lot to our PC experience. The problem is, for as great as some of that hardware can be, far too often using it means being stuck with some clunky software. And thatâ€™s exactly why Razerâ€™s latest news has us sitting up to take notice. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Can you believe the Yaber Projector L2s is only $102 right now?!
items.summary: This projector has never been cheaper!
items.body: I grew up dreaming of having a projector, but they were expensive, bulky, and honestly, not that good! Things have definitely changed, and this deal gets you a pretty good projector like the Yaber Projector L2s Home Cinema for just a bit over $100! Buy the Yaber Projector L2s Home Cinema for just $101.97 ($68.02 off)

items.title: Hadjar crashes new Red Bull in F1 testing
items.summary: Newly promoted Red Bull driver Isack Hadjar crashes his car in wet conditions on the second day of Formula 1 pre-season testing.

items.title: Spurs striker Kolo Muani 'fine' after car accident
items.summary: Randal Kolo Muani is "fine" after a "minor" car accident and should be available for Spurs' Champions League match at Eintracht Frankfurt, says Thomas Frank.

items.title: One UI 8.5 will give Now Bar a function it shouldâ€™ve had a while ago
items.summary: Samsung's Now Bar will get a little more useful with One UI 8.5.
items.body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority TL;DR The One UI 8.5 beta introduces a new capability to Now Bar on your Galaxy phone. Now Bar can now show missed call notifications. Now Bar, a widget that gives you quick access to live information and app controls on your lockscreen, was introduced in One UI 7. Since its debut, Samsung has added to its capabilities, like showing win probabilities of sports matches and support for Commute from Google. It appears that One UI 8.5 will make Now Bar even more useful. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Koepka 'rang Woods first' over PGA Tour return
items.summary: Five-time major winner Brooks Koepka says Tiger Woods was the first person he called to discuss a return to the PGA Tour after leaving the LIV Golf circuit.

items.title: Conte reunion a sharp reminder of Chelsea's fall
items.summary: Chelsea have not won the Premier League since Antonio Conte led them to the title in 2017 - and now they face the Italian's Napoli side in the Champions League.

items.title: Latest Galaxy S26 rumor has us wondering about launch colors
items.summary: Four colors or six?
items.body: TL;DR A leaker posted today that the S26 series will launch in four colorways: Black, White, Cobalt Violet, and Sky Blue. This lines up with a leak we saw earlier in the month, but not a more recent rumor from last week. Leaker Evan Blass recently claimed the S26 would launch in six colors. Amid a recent blitz of Galaxy S26 rumors and leaks, weâ€™ve heard about color options a couple of times: first in the context of leaked images of the S26 Ultraâ€™s SIM card tray , then in a second rumor that corroborated the colors from that initial leak while claiming the existence of two more. Today, though, weâ€™ve got a conflicting report that lines up with the SIM card tray leak, but doesnâ€™t mention the other colorways we heard about later. Leaker theonecid posted on Twitter today that the Galaxy S26 series will come in four colors: black, white, Cobalt Violet, and Sky Blue. Those are the same colors seen in images of the Ultra modelâ€™s SIM tray posted earlier this month by Ice Universe â€” but todayâ€™s post notably lacks the â€œsilver shadowâ€ and â€œpink goldâ€ colorways leaker Evan Blass claimed would be available on the S26 Ultra last week.

items.title: Apple AirPods Pro 3 drop to record-low price!
items.summary: Catch a great deal on Apple's best earbuds!
items.body: Credit: Sound Guys We just reported on a hot deal on the Apple AirPods Max , but not everyone needs the higher-end, larger headphones. If you want something smaller for your commutes or prefer earbuds overall, hereâ€™s another great deal for Apple users. The Apple AirPods Pro 3 just dropped to their record-low price of $199, saving you $50. Buy the Apple AirPods Pro 3 for $199 ($50 off)

items.title: 'I have my own opinion' - Slot responds to Liverpool criticism
items.summary: Liverpool head coach Arne Slot admits he's aware of the "noise" around the club after just five wins in their past 18 Premier League matches, but refuses to define what an "acceptable" outcome to the season would look like to him.

items.title: This hot Apple AirPods Max deal will be gone tonight!
items.summary: You have under 12 hours to catch this sale!
items.body: If you are invested in the Apple ecosystem, there are no better headphones to get than the Apple AirPods Max. They are pricey, but right now, you can get them at a nice $119.01 discount. Youâ€™d best act quickly, though, because this rare offer ends tonight! Buy the Apple AirPods Max for just $429.99 ($119.01 off)

items.title: Googleâ€™s best AI plan comes to the US for just $8 a month
items.summary: The awesome AI Plus plan finally drops its geographic restrictions.
items.body: TL;DR Google AI Plus launched last summer, initially in Indonesia, as the companyâ€™s most affordable AI plan While Google expanded access to 40 more countries, the US still wasnâ€™t on that list. Now Google AI Plus is available anywhere Pro and Ultra are, including the US at just $8 a month. The rise of powerful AI services has complicated modern life in more ways than one. And for a lot of us, that includes a new question we need to consider: Should I be paying for better AI? While something like Google Gemini can do a whole, whole lot for us without making us pay one extra dime , there are also people who are willing to pay a shocking amount of money for unfettered access to the best AI tools around. Between those extremes, Googleâ€™s AI Plus plan emerged as a nice balance of affordability and feature set â€” and now Googleâ€™s making it available to Gemini users everywhere. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Why England legend Root is so effective in Asia
items.summary: After another masterclass in Asian conditions, BBC Sport breaks down how Joe Root stands out as a brilliant player of spin bowling.

items.title: Galaxy A37 renders give us our first look at Samsungâ€™s budget phone
items.summary: Galaxy A37 renders show off lavender color, triple camera setup, and thick bezels.
items.body: Credit: Android Headlines TL;DR Renders of the Galaxy A37 have leaked. The images show that the phone has a similar design to the Galaxy A57. The device features a triple rear camera setup, a flat display, a front camera, and an island for the volume and power keys. Earlier today, renders of the Galaxy A57 surfaced, showing off the deviceâ€™s design. Now renders of its sibling, the Galaxy A37, have also leaked. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Googleâ€™s AI Overview summaries now let you ask follow-up questions on mobile
items.summary: AI Overviews are getting conversational.
items.body: TL;DR An update to AI Overviews lets users move right into an AI Mode â€œconversationâ€ to ask follow-up questions. Gemini 3 now powers AI Overview responses. These changes are rolling out starting today. Google Searchâ€™s AI Overviews and AI Mode are closely related: both pull info from the across web and attempt to boil it down into plain-language answers to user questions. Today, Google announced that, if the initial summary at the top of Search doesnâ€™t answer your question and you donâ€™t feel like clicking any links, you can now hop from an AI Overview right into a conversation-style exchange with AI Mode to ask follow-ups. Google has announced in a blog post that starting today, when you tap the Show more button that appears toward the bottom of an AI Overview in Search on mobile, the full overview will be accompanied by a new text box that reads Ask anything. Entering another question in that box will kick you over to AI Mode.

items.title: NFL head coach tracker - Bills appoint Brady
items.summary: Check the latest on the NFL hiring cycle as teams start to fill their vacant head coach roles after the regular season.

items.title: Google wants to settle class action suit alleging Assistant was spying on you
items.summary: Assistant eavesdropping suit will likely be settled for $68M.
items.body: TL;DR Google has filed a preliminary class action settlement agreeing to pay $68M in an Assistant privacy suit. Plaintiffs alleged that they were targeted with ads based on conversations that Assistant was never supposed to be listening to. Despite its willingness to settle, Google denies any wrongdoing. How much of your life have you lived with a smart speaker listening in on you? The original Google Home turns 10 later this year, and Amazon Echoâ€™s been around even longer. For as convenient as this kind of smart home hardware can be, are we sacrificing too much of our privacy by having it around? That old question is back on our minds again this week, as we get word about some big progress in a class-action Google Assistant privacy lawsuit. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: This Galaxy Watch game makes better use of the rotating bezel than most apps
items.summary: A Redditor rethought the classic Snake for round screens and rotating bezels.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR A Redditor is building a new version of Snake for Galaxy Watch, and it already looks better than most Wear OS alternatives. Bezel controls and a circular playfield make it feel natural on a smartwatch. The game isnâ€™t finished or publicly available yet, but itâ€™s a promising proof of concept. Like many of you, Iâ€™m old enough to remember when the Nokia 3210 was the phone to have, and Snake was the game everyone played. It was ultra simple and brutally addictive. As far as weâ€™ve come with mobile gaming, itâ€™s hard to match the nostalgia of those halcyon days, especially on a smartwatch . Thatâ€™s why a recent post on Redditâ€™s Galaxy Watch community caught our attention. A developer going by JackGrylls shared an early build of a Snake-style game made specifically for Galaxy Watch and Wear OS, aiming to bring back the feel of the old bezel-controlled version they remember from the Tizen days.

items.title: Slot targets 'special things' with Liverpool as 'noise' persists

items.title: The Samsung Galaxy S26 Ultra could make display nerds very happy
items.summary: Samsung's next flagship might have a 10-bit display.
items.body: TL;DR A new rumor says the Galaxy S26 Ultra could come with a 10-bit display. This would make the phone capable of natively displaying roughly 1.07 billion discrete colors. Last yearâ€™s Galaxy S25 Ultra features an 8-bit display that uses a software technique to simulate 10-bit color. Samsung Galaxy S26 rumors have been heating up lately. In recent weeks, weâ€™ve seen credible rumors about color options , storage configurations , materials , and more. Today, a new rumor says we should expect a fairly significant display upgrade. Samsungâ€™s 2025 Galaxy S lineup uses display panels with 8-bit color depth, which are capable of reproducing about 16.7 million discrete colors. Prolific leaker Ice Universe tweeted this morning that the Galaxy S26 Ultra will feature a 10-bit panel, drastically increasing the number of colors the phoneâ€™s screen can display.

Spotify music videos feel so normal now that itâ€™s easy to forget theyâ€™re still officially a beta feature. Thatâ€™s a good thing, because it means some of the rough edges are still being ironed out. One of the biggest issues with them is what happens when you leave the Now Playing screen while a video is playing, and it looks like Spotify might be following YouTubeâ€™s example in working on a fix. items.title: Hereâ€™s why OnePlus bricked your phone when you tried downgrading it
items.summary: OnePlus has finally spoken out after some enthusiasts reported bricked devices.
items.body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR OnePlus has spoken out after some users experienced bricked devices when trying to downgrade their phones or install custom ROMs. The company confirmed that it had â€œtemporarily pausedâ€ downgrades from 16.0.2.50x firmware versions due to security reasons. OnePlus added that it will restore the ability to downgrade in its next regular software update. OnePlus drew the ire of some enthusiasts last week when it emerged that new firmware for select devices introduced Anti-Rollback Protection (ARB). This hardware-level protection measure means users would brick their devices if they tried to downgrade the software or install a custom ROM. Fortunately, OnePlus has revealed that this isnâ€™t a permanent state of affairs. OnePlus told Android Authority in an emailed response that this was a temporary measure to boost security:

items.title: Galaxy Z TriFold finally lands in the US, and hereâ€™s how much it costs
items.summary: Itching to try it? You can already do that at Samsung Exclusive stores in the US.
items.body: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F3ctDr1dHgc TL;DR Samsung is bringing the Galaxy Z TriFold to the US. You will be able to buy it starting later this week through Samsungâ€™s online and select offline stores in the US. The TriFoldâ€™s 512GB variant is priced at $2,899. The recently unveiled Galaxy Z TriFold is an impressive piece of technology. While the design and the heft may feel less practical than a standard book-style foldable, such as the Galaxy Z Fold 7, the limitations are easily offset by its utility. The TriFold is essentially a large Android tablet that fits in your pocket, and it may be the perfect device if you fancy using three apps side-by-side. And if youâ€™re in the US and have been waiting to lay your hands on the Galaxy Z TriFold, we have good news. As promised , Samsung is officially bringing the Galaxy Z TriFold to the US, and eager customers will be able to buy it starting Friday, January 30. The pricing for the Galaxy Z TriFold with 512GB storage is set at $2,899, and it will be available through Samsungâ€™s online and offline retail stores. The Korean market also gets a 1TB variant, so we hope to hear a bit more about its availability in the US.

items.title: Anbernicâ€™s GBA SP-like handheld just lost half its memory (Update: Statement)

items.body: Credit: ANBERNIC TL;DR Anbernic quietly made a change to its Game Boy Advance SP-like RG34XXSP handheld. Previously, the RG34XXSP offered 2GB of RAM, now it only comes with 1GB. When contacted, Anbernicâ€™s support team confirmed the downgrade. Update: January 27, 2026 (9:57 AM ET): A spokesperson for Anbernic has provided the following statement to Android Authority about the recent RAM change for the RG34XXSP. We sincerely apologize for any confusion or concern this change may have caused. The upgrade of the RG34XXSPâ€™s RAM from its original configuration to 1GB was implemented in response to the component shortage in the market. Please rest assured this update has no impact on the performance of Linux-based systems, and all core functionality remains fully intact and reliable.

items.title: YouTube is experimenting with paywalling this popular free feature (Update: Statement)
items.summary: YouTube's latest experiment adds playback speed as a Premium feature.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR YouTube appears to be running a new experiment The test involves paywalling its popular playback speed feature. The test separates users into two categories: one where the feature is still free and the other where playback speed is a Premium feature. Update: January 27, 2026 (9:47 AM ET): A Google spokesperson has informed Android Authority that itâ€™s unclear what the exact situation is for this specific user. However, YouTube users without Premium can still access playback speeds up to 2x and adjust the speed in 0.05 increments. Meanwhile, Premium users can play videos at speeds up to 4x. The spokesperson adds that the company often runs experiments to specifically highlight premium features to non-subscribers as a way to encourage trying out Premium. Itâ€™s possible this user may be seeing a prompt to sign up for Premium in order to use speeds above 2x.

items.title: Apple shames Android with a software update for a 13-year-old iPhone
items.summary: These ancient iPhones get a surprise 2026 update to keep iMessage and FaceTime from breaking.
items.body: Credit: Robert Triggs / Android Authority TL;DR Apple just updated 10+ year-old devices to extend a digital certificate that keeps iMessage, FaceTime, and device setup working past 2027. Without this fix, these devices would slowly break. Once the certificate expired, theyâ€™d lose access to Appleâ€™s servers and core features. The update is about functional life support, not new features; devices remain on old iOS 12 and many modern apps wonâ€™t work. Supporting a smartphone for more than a decade sounds almost impossible with how quickly new models come out these days, as in the case of Android models . But this week, Apple did just that by releasing a software update for iPhones that were first released more than 10 years ago. Apple has quietly released iOS 12.5.8, a surprise update for legacy hardware that canâ€™t run modern versions of iOS, as spotted by a Reddit user . This includes the iPhone 5s, iPhone 6, iPhone 6 Plus, the original iPad Air, the iPad mini 2 and 3, and even the sixth-generation iPod touch.

items.title: Forget emulators, native ports of PS2 games may be closer than ever
items.summary: This new tool may enable (relatively) easy native PC ports of PS2 games for the first time.
items.body: Credit: Hadlee Simons / Android Authority TL;DR A new tool called PS2Recomp has emerged to create native PC ports of PS2 games. The project has garnered significant attention from a viral Tweet on Monday. The tool is not yet finished, but the goal is similar to other projects like N64: Recompiled. While emulation continues to make baby steps toward better compatibility, game decompilations and recompilations offer a different pathway toward game preservation. Instead of running the original game files, they transform them into code that runs on PCs and other modern hardware. Now, for the first time, itâ€™s looking like a new console is joining the party: the Sony PlayStation 2. A new tool called PS2Recomp has gained significant attention, mostly thanks to a viral Tweet from yesterday. Although itâ€™s far from being finished, the goal is to statically recompile PS2 games into modern C++. Combined with the right renderer, this code can then be turned into a native PC port with significantly better performance than any traditional emulator can offer.

This patent, in particular, addresses mounting the cell within the phone itself and highlights some interesting potential, especially for user-replaceable batteries.

items.title: The best Switch emulator now runs Metroid Prime 4 and Luigiâ€™s Mansion 3 more smoothly
items.summary: Despite a Nintendo DMCA, Eden continues to deliver huge improvements.
items.body: Credit: Nick Fernandez / Android Authority TL;DR Switch emulator Eden just dropped its first major update of the year, and the first minor version bump. It includes several improvements, including better compatibility with both stock Qualcomm and Turnip drivers. On Android, thereâ€™s a new quick settings menu accessible during emulation. Despite Nintendoâ€™s Play Store DMCA , the Switch emulator Eden remains in very active development, with the team dropping its first major update of the year today. Itâ€™s the first minor version bump in the history of the project, bumping it to version 0.1.0. The update fixes several regressions from version 0.0.4, as well as long-standing bugs from its Yuzu ancestor. As a result, popular games like Metroid Prime 4 and Luigiâ€™s Mansion 3 are now more playable than ever, with fewer crashes and graphical glitches.

Notion is where I keep all my recipes, meeting notes, and data related to things like my fitness journey and various side projects. I wanted to ditch Notion because of its complexity and move to something designed around simplicity and focus. So, I switched to iA Writer , and I donâ€™t think Iâ€™ll ever go back.

items.title: Samsung might have high hopes for the Wide Fold
items.summary: Samsung's iPhone Fold rival will boast a wide aspect ratio, and a new report suggests this won't be a limited release.
items.body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR Samsung apparently plans to produce one million units of its rumored Wide Fold foldable phone. This strongly suggests that the Wide Fold could see a broad release across a variety of countries. The phone is tipped to have a 4:3 folding display, and will likely be a response to the iPhone Fold. Samsung is widely expected to launch a so-called Wide Fold later this year, which will apparently offer a wider folding screen than its previous Galaxy Z Fold devices. Now, a Korean outlet has revealed more details about the product. ET News reports that Samsung plans to produce one million Wide Fold units in 2026. It notes that this would be the most units produced for a special edition foldable phone. By contrast, Samsung reportedly shipped just 30,000 Galaxy Z TriFold units and 500,000 Galaxy Z Fold 6 Special Edition units. However, a source told the outlet that Samsung could still produce more Wide Fold units depending on the market response.

The bouncy, responsive animations, big buttons, and distinctive shapes/colors result in an Android interface I love spending time with â€” and itâ€™s a big reason I carry a Pixel every day instead of an Android phone from another brand. items.title: Love Gemini? Google doesnâ€™t want you to get too attached
items.summary: Gemini on Android may soon start reminding you to "Take a short break" after long usage.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Google is testing reminders for you to take breaks when using Gemini for long periods. These reminders may also remind you that youâ€™re talking to an AI that isnâ€™t human. This may be due to the effort to prevent AI dependence or emotional bonds. AI has become increasingly useful for helping us offload gruntwork and some of the thinking we would typically do ourselves. While this is expected to increase productivity, at least from an industrial standpoint, researchers have also cautioned against addictive AI usage patterns , especially in young adults. To fend this off, AI companies are working on measures to dissuade users from using chatbots obsessively , and Google may be adding its warnings to Gemini. items.title: Goodbye, Google Discover: I finally found the best use case for AI browsers
items.summary: I can't imagine a browser doing everything for me, but that's not how I use Comet.
items.body: The communityâ€™s hatred of AI is completely valid. Even I canâ€™t help but scoff when I hear about new features landing on operating systems that donâ€™t need them, or apps with additions that offer no tangible benefit. This was my reaction when the first AI web browsers appeared on Windows and the Play Store. However, since I need to stay updated on developments like this, I gritted my teeth and jumped in with both feet. My first AI browser, Arc Search , was surprisingly good. It was less a browser and more a souped-up search experience, but I did enjoy how it handled search queries. While I didnâ€™t see it as a primary browser â€” it would never replace Firefox on my Android phone â€” I was disappointed when The Browser Company announced new things and left Arc behind.

items.title: Your Belkin Wemo smart home device could stop working this week: Hereâ€™s what to do about it
items.summary: There's a chance for you to still resurrect older devices.
items.body: TL;DR Belkin will shut down its Wemo cloud service for smart home devices later this week. Around two dozen devices are at risk of going obsolete, but you might be eligible for a partial refund if you bought them recently. However, if your device supports Apple HomeKit or Thread, it is immune to the shutdown. The shutdown date for Belkinâ€™s Wemo smart home app is almost upon us. On January 31, 2026, Wemoâ€™s cloud service will be shuttered, and any devices that run on it will effectively be turned into dumb devices (if they can still function, as with light bulbs). Therefore, Belkin is sending final reminders to owners and telling them they may be eligible for refunds in certain cases. After first announcing Wemoâ€™s shutdown back in July last year, Belkin is sending emails to users again, reminding them to arrange alternatives if needed. In its email to existing users, Belkin also notes that while its Wemo cloud interface is shutting down, devices compatible with Appleâ€™s HomeKit or Threadâ€™s IoT protocol will continue to work through their respective services.

items.title: Samsung seemingly considered a camera button on Galaxy S26. Would you want one?
items.summary: A Samsung supply chain partner apparently developed an Apple-style camera button for the Galaxy S26 series.
items.body: Credit: Android Headlines TL;DR A former employee at a Samsung supplier revealed on LinkedIn that they had worked on a camera button for the Galaxy S26 series. The camera button wouldâ€™ve also offered swipe functionality, akin to Appleâ€™s Camera Control key on recent iPhones. We donâ€™t see a camera button on unofficial renders, while prominent leakers havenâ€™t mentioned the feature, either. Samsung is expected to launch the Galaxy S26 series next month, and weâ€™ve already seen a ton of leaks about these phones. Weâ€™re pretty sure the phones wonâ€™t have a dedicated camera button, though. However, new evidence spotted by Android Authority reveals that the company at least explored the possibility. A former employee at a Samsung supplier revealed on LinkedIn that they had worked on a â€œnew camera button with swipe gesture functionalityâ€ for the Samsung Galaxy S26. Check out the screenshot below.

items.title: Samsung just launched a new Galaxy Z Flip 7 model you canâ€™t (officially) buy
items.summary: There's only one official way to get your hands on this phone.
items.body: Credit: Hadlee Simons / Android Authority TL;DR Samsung has announced the Galaxy Z Flip 7 Olympic Edition smartphone. The phone features an Olympic-themed design and comes with a magnet case. The device wonâ€™t go on sale, but will instead be given to almost 3,800 athletes at the 2026 Winter Olympics and Paralympics. Samsung has offered Olympic Edition Galaxy Z Flip models for a few years now, and with the 2026 Winter Olympics and Paralympics upon us, the company has now launched another special edition Flip phone. Samsung launched the Galaxy Z Flip 7 Olympic Edition today, and, much like previous models, it offers a unique design. Expect a gold-colored frame and camera rings, along with a blue rear cover featuring the Olympic rings. Samsung says the phone also comes with a clear magnet case, featuring a blue magnet and gold laurel leaves.

items.title: Who has made Troy's Premier League team of the week?
items.summary: After every round of Premier League matches this season, Troy Deeney gives us his team of the week. Do you agree with his choices?

items.title: Gemini in Google Calendar is getting so good at scheduling meetings, interns will be out of work
items.summary: It can now compare everyoneâ€™s availability for you. If only it could make coffee.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Gemini in Google Calendar can now suggest meeting times that work for all attendees. The feature compares calendars, working hours, and conflicts, making it well-suited to group meetings. If multiple people decline an invite, Calendar can now suggest a better time to reschedule. The way itâ€™s progressing, Google will soon know when your meeting is before you do. Back in October, it introduced the Help me schedule feature , which helped you suggest sensible meeting times based on your availability and the context of an email. That was useful, but it still left you to find out if the time worked for the other party. This latest update takes a bigger step by figuring out when everyone is actually free. According to a new Google Workspace update , Google is rolling out smarter suggested meeting times directly inside Google Calendar. When youâ€™re creating an event, youâ€™ll see a Suggested times option that uses Gemini to scan attendee availability, working hours, and existing conflicts, then surface the time slots that make the most sense for the whole group â€” assuming you have access to those calendars. Unlike Octoberâ€™s email-centric apprâ€¦

items.title: Galaxy A57 images reveal a shockingly thin frame and lavender hue
items.summary: The phone's design was revealed through official certification images filed with TENAA.
items.body: Credit: Paul Jones / Android Authority TL;DR The Galaxy A57 has surfaced on Chinaâ€™s TENAA database, giving us an early, official-looking preview of Samsungâ€™s next mid-range phone. The A57 could be just 6.9mm thick, matching rumored Galaxy S26 dimensions. TENAA photos show the same vertical camera layout and Key Island buttons, now paired with what appears to be a metal frame. Samsungâ€™s mid-range phones usually play it safe, but the upcoming Galaxy A57 is looking to stir things up by trimming the fat. As everyone focuses on the Galaxy S26 , a recent listing from Chinaâ€™s TENAA certification agency has given us an early look at the upcoming model. If youâ€™ve held a Galaxy A56 , the new model should feel familiar but more premium. The TENAA images show the same vertical camera stack as before. The frame looks like itâ€™s made of metal, which should make it more durable, and it uses the Key Island design, where the power and volume buttons are on a slightly raised part of the frame.

items.title: Nothing Phone 4a certification suggests launch may not be far off
items.summary: Nothing Phone 4a gets one step closer to launch.
items.body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR The Nothing Phone 4a has been certified in the UAE by TDRA. The certification listing reveals the device carries the model number A069. Nothing recently launched a Community Edition of the Phone 3a , but what is the phone maker up to now? We learned last month that the company has at least two phones in the pipeline, the Nothing Phone 4a and Phone 4a Pro . One of these handsets has now been spotted on a certification database. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Google Photos fixes the most frustrating part of its photo-to-video tool
items.summary: You don't need to get lucky when animating your photos anymore.
items.body: TL;DR Google Photos now lets you type prompts to control how your photos are turned into videos. The text prompts can be refined after your first pass, and Google will also offer suggestions. We previously spotted the custom prompt option in testing. When Google first rolled out its AI photo-to-video tools in Google Photos, the idea was nice, but the execution could feel a little hit-or-miss. You could ask for subtle movement, or tap â€œIâ€™m feeling luckyâ€ and see what happens. Sometimes it worked as you expected. Other times, not so much. Thatâ€™s now changing. In a support page post , Google just introduced a text prompts element to the Photo to video feature. The new option gives you a say in how your pictures are animated instead of leaving everything up to the AIâ€™s mood. Videos generated with the tool can also include audio by default, which should make the results feel a bit more finished when you share them.

items.title: Hereâ€™s an early look at how app lock and other Android 17 changes are coming together
items.summary: Can't get enough of those translucent volume bars.
items.body: TL;DR Screenshots offer a peak at Googleâ€™s work on several changes weâ€™re expecting to debut with Android 17. Weâ€™ve been anticipating new screen recording tools for tablets, and here we see the same UI for phones. Googleâ€™s been working on a tool to lock down access to apps, and we find a few signs of it here. Android 17 is set to deliver a lot of changes to our favorite mobile operating system, not just in terms of new functionality, but also with updates to the look and feel of existing systems. We just brought you a look at some of its new translucency effects a few hours ago, and now weâ€™ve got a handful of additional images to share, highlighting even more changes due to arrive with Androidâ€™s next major release. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Somewhat ironically, Verizon is declared the most reliable network in new report
items.summary: Verizon just won several awards for performance, even if not all Verizon users will likely agree.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR The latest RootMetricsâ€™ State of the Mobile Union report is in, and it seems Verizon has outperformed itself across many major categories. Not surprisingly, Verizon did not lead in network speed, with T-Mobile and AT&T tied for fastest. Keep in mind, real-world network performance varies by location, so national rankings may not reflect individual user experiences. Verizon has taken a reputational hit over the last few years. There are many reasons for this shift. Some feel Verizon has dropped the ball when it comes to network quality and performance, but there have also been staff cuts, inconsistent promises, and other issues. Most recently, Verizon suffered a major service outage that affected a large portion of customers across its network . Despite its current reputation, Verizon is still far from down and out. In fact, it is riding relatively high in the latest State of the Mobile Union report from RootMetrics .

items.title: Galaxy Buds 4 series makes an appearance in an unexpected place
items.summary: Samsung slips up and unintentionally confirms the Galaxy Buds 4 series.
items.body: Credit: AssembleDebug / Android Authority TL;DR The Galaxy Buds 4 and Buds 4 Pro leaked in the support section of the Samsung Members app. Both the base and Pro models appeared on the device selection screen for troubleshooting. The next-generation earbuds are expected to debut during a Galaxy Unpacked event in February. Samsung is expected to launch the next generation of its base and Pro-level Galaxy Buds during Galaxy Unpacked in February. Thanks to One UI 8.5 leaks, we were able to uncover images and animations for both models, revealing a new design. We also discovered a few details about the earbuds, like certain gesture controls . While thereâ€™s no doubt that the Galaxy Buds 4 and Galaxy Buds 4 Pro are coming, a new leak has further confirmed their existence. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Appleâ€™s latest AirTag upgrade puts pressure back on Android rivals
items.summary: It's an incremental update with big implications for the competition.
items.body: Credit: Apple TL;DR Apple has announced a new AirTag with a longer Precision Finding range, improved Bluetooth detection, and a much louder built-in speaker. The updated AirTag also adds Precision Finding support on Apple Watch, making it easier to track items without pulling out your phone. Pricing stays the same as before, starting at $29 for one AirTag or $99 for a four-pack. After last monthâ€™s leak pointing to a long-overdue refresh, Apple has officially unveiled a new version of its AirTag tracker. While it has been referred to as the â€œAirTag 2â€ in the past, Apple isnâ€™t using that name. This is simply the new AirTag, and itâ€™s focused on a more extended range, easier findability, and tighter integration with Appleâ€™s ecosystem. According to the Apple Newsroom , the updated AirTag offers a significantly improved Precision Finding experience thanks to the companyâ€™s second-generation Ultra Wideband chip. Apple says you can now locate an AirTag from up to 50% farther away than before, while an upgraded Bluetooth chip also extends the range at which nearby devices can help detect it through the Find My network.

items.title: No sponsor, kit on order & visa wait - Scotland embrace late World Cup call
items.summary: Scotland are "confident" visa issues will not prevent them arriving late for the men's T20 World Cup as chief executive Trudy Lindblade tells BBC Stumped about their "unique" preparations after a late call to the tournament.

items.title: YouTube Music finally syncs playback across devices the way it should have all along
items.summary: A nice little quality-of-life improvement.
items.body: TL;DR YouTube Music now allows users to resume playback from one mobile device on another mobile device. The platform previously only let users resume playback from desktop on mobile. Back in July , YouTube Music was updated to sync playback progress between devices. At the time, that ability only worked when moving from a mobile device to the desktop web app or vice versa. Now, though, the platform will let you resume your queue from pretty much any device on any other device. As reported by 9to5Google , YouTube Musicâ€™s Now Playing queue now picks up where you left off, regardless of which device you were listening on before. That means you can, for example, resume a playlist you were listening to on your iPad when you leave the house with just your Android phone.

items.title: Garmin accidentally leaked an unannounced wearable
items.summary: Garmin may be getting ready to launch a new band-style wearable.
items.body: Credit: Kaitlyn Cimino / Android Authority TL;DR Garmin is preparing to release a new wearable called the Cirqa Smart Band. Evidence of the device was spotted on the companyâ€™s Canadian website. The wrist-based smart band will come in two sizes and two colors. Earlier this month, at CES 2026, Garmin announced that full nutrition tracking was coming to Garmin Connect. On the heels of that announcement, it seems another announcement from the company could come soon. It appears the company has a new wearable in the works and a leak has shared the first details. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.summary: Repeatedly heading footballs is "likely" to have contributed to the brain disease which was a factor in the death of former Scotland and Manchester United footballer Gordon McQueen, an inquest found. His daughters spoke after the verdict.

items.title: Donâ€™t fall for fake listings when buying a retro Android gaming handheld
items.summary: Scam websites are impersonating some of the most popular gaming handheld brands.
items.body: Credit: Nick Fernandez / Android Authority TL;DR AYN announced that many customers have complained about scam websites selling its handhelds. The company â€œcannot guarantee any sort of protectionâ€ for devices purchased from unaffiliated websites. Customers should always use company websites or official stores on marketplaces like Amazon or AliExpress. Despite their somewhat legally dubious origins, Android gaming handheld makers have taken a lot of steps toward legitimacy in recent years. The big players, like Retroid, AYN, and AYANEO, donâ€™t ship devices with any copyrighted material, and most now offer some sort of warranty on products. However, that hasnâ€™t stopped scams from popping up in other parts of the web, prompting AYN to send out a warning message this morning. The company writes that it has received reports of unaffiliated websites selling its products online. These range from overpriced resellers to outright scams, and the company warns that it â€œcannot guarantee any sort of protection if you purchase from non-AYN sites.â€ The company also notes that only emails from addresses ending in @ayn.hk are official AYN staff members.

items.title: Android 17 could take a page from Liquid Glass, and hereâ€™s a close look
items.summary: A recent leak points to more blur in Android 17, and we've now got images to share.
items.body: TL;DR A recent leak suggests Android 17 could gain even more blur effects, and weâ€™ve obtained images showing some of these new elements. The images show that the volume menu and pop-up volume slider could have blur effects. This comes a while after Android 16â€™s Material 3 Expressive update introduced some blur and transparency. Google already offers some subtle blur and translucency effects in Android 16 , but a recent leak suggests the company could up the ante with Android 17 . Now, we have obtained images showing Android 17â€™s increased blur effects. NEWSLETTER | Authority Insights --> Authority Insights You're reading an Authority Insights story. Subscribe to our new Authority Insights newsletter for more exclusive reports, app teardowns, leaks, and in-depth tech coverage you won't find anywhere else. sign up now By signing up, you agree to our Terms of Use and acknowledge the data practices in our Privacy Policy. You may unsubscribe at any time. MysticLeaks on Telegram posted and then quickly deleted images apparently showing an internal build of Android 17. These images purportedly showed blur effects in almost every part of the UI. We werenâ€™t able to view these screenshots aâ€¦

items.title: Seahawks see off Rams in thriller to reach Super Bowl
items.summary: The Seattle Seahawks beat the Los Angeles Rams 31-27 in a thrilling NFC Championship match to set up a rerun of the 2015 Super Bowl against the New England Patriots.

items.title: Is it worth sticking with Verizon right now? Your answers were revealing
items.summary: Coverage, cost, and customer service all factored into your answers to our poll.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority You might sometimes find yourself looking at your phone bill and wondering whether itâ€™s finally time to ditch your big carrier for something cheaper. You wouldnâ€™t be the only one who has this passing thought on a monthly basis. Verizon in particular tends to spark strong opinions whenever we cover it, especially as prepaid plans keep getting more competitive. After my colleagueâ€™s thoughts on the topic, we decided to ask you whether thereâ€™s a good reason to leave Verizon right now or if itâ€™s worth sticking with it for the time being. We stuck the poll in Andrew Grushâ€™s own back-and-forth article over whether he should finally leave Verizon himself . The move to prepaid made sense on paper, especially after paying off most of the devices on his account. But once Verizon started stacking discounts and even offered a temporary free line, the math wasnâ€™t quite as clear-cut to him anymore. He wasnâ€™t suddenly Verizonâ€™s biggest fan, but the extra incentives slowed his urgency to jump ship.

items.title: Baseus Nomos NH21: Keep your desk clutter-free and all devices powered!
items.summary: The Baseus Nomos is the ultimate desktop charging station series for creators, professionals, programmers, and more.
items.body: As a working professional and techie, keeping my desk tidy is a constant challenge that never ends. Hereâ€™s something that will make the process much more seamless, all while keeping all your devices powered and ready for the next task. The new Baseus Nomos NH21 6-in-1 Desktop Charging Station has a max output of 245W. Itâ€™s the ultimate solution for creators, professionals, programmers, or anyone whose job requires spending a bunch of time in front of a screen. Letâ€™s dig deeper into the details!

items.title: Did the Pixel Weather app let you down during the snowstorm? Youâ€™re not alone.
items.summary: The app's AI weather report also made up a word. Who knew weather could be described as "flurzy"?
items.body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR Some Pixel owners have complained that the Pixel Weather app offered seriously inaccurate forecasts during a recent snowstorm in North America. The app seemed to report much lower snowfall and higher temperatures than what actually occurred. The appâ€™s AI weather report feature also made up a word, describing the day as â€œflurzy.â€ Google launched the Pixel Weather app back in 2024, and itâ€™s a pretty neat and practical addition to Pixel phones . Unfortunately, many users have reported that the app offered woefully inaccurate weather forecasts in the wake of a recent snowstorm. Pixel owners have created numerous Reddit threads to report that the Pixel Weather app delivered incorrect weather forecasts during snowstorms in North America. More specifically, many owners report that the app reported much lower snowfall than what actually occurred.

items.title: Banjo: Recompiled adds widescreen, dual-stick controls, and mod support to the N64 hit
items.summary: Banjo-Kazooie has never looked (or played) this good.
items.body: TL;DR A new Banjo-Kazooie fan port is now available on PC, Mac, and Linux. Banjo: Recompiled adds widescreen support, higher framerates, better controls, mod support, and more. The recomp requires an original ROM of the game and contains no copyrighted assets. The N64 decomp and recomp scene has exploded in the past year, and over the weekend, the latest release was shadowdropped out of nowhere. Despite being a fan project with no involvement from Nintendo or Microsoft (which owns Rare), the Banjo-Kazooie recompilation is fully playable on PC, Linux, and Mac, and fixes and modernizes many aspects of the classic 3D platformer. Banjo: Recompiled is essentially a full remaster of the original game, improving frame rates and adding widescreen support for modern displays. It also enables the use of a second analog stick to control the camera, providing a much more modern control scheme than the C buttons on the N64 controller.

items.title: Siri is getting Gemini superpowers, and that could be awful for Android
items.summary: Fixing Siri with Gemini might remove Androidâ€™s biggest unsaid advantage.
items.body: At this point, it should probably be accepted as a universal fact that Siri is one of the weakest voice assistants in the world. That was true before its redesign in iOS 18, and itâ€™s still true even after Apple added ChatGPT. The new smarts may have given Siri a new brain, but Siri still hasnâ€™t figured out how to use that brain properly. Weâ€™ve collectively bullied Siri for years (rightfully so), to the point that Apple has now decided to partner with Google and base Siri on none other than its biggest â€” and far better â€” competitor, Gemini. Thereâ€™s something deeply funny about a company using its rivalâ€™s underlying tech because it couldnâ€™t quite build its own or find a better alternative.

items.title: Google could bring a taste of Appleâ€™s Liquid Glass to Android 17
items.summary: Android 17 leak shows Google is finally embracing Appleâ€™s translucent look.
items.body: TL;DR Android 17 is said to be shifting away from flat design toward translucent, blur-heavy visuals. Google could roll out a frosted-glass look across core UI elements, including the volume slider and power menu. Dynamic Color will reportedly tint blurred panels, helping the new transparency effects blend with your wallpaper and theme. Android 17 is still months from its official launch, but itâ€™s clear that Google plans to change how you use your phone. After years of flat, solid colors, the next version â€” codenamed â€œCinnamon Bunâ€ â€” is said to focus on translucent, blurry backgrounds. We saw the seeds of this change planted last year with the introduction of Material 3 Expressive , which brought subtle blurs to the notification shade and the Quick Settings panel. Google wanted to create a sense of depth so that the user interface felt lightweight rather than like a heavy, opaque wall of color blocking your view.

items.title: Cal-fouri, a lesser-spotted law & Russell v the Shed - Prem talking points
items.summary: Noah Caluori's teenage kicks continue as Finn Russell asks for quiet and Tommy Freeman and Henry Pollock benefit from an obscure corner of the law book.

items.title: 5 Android phones you should buy instead of the Samsung Galaxy A56
items.summary: The Galaxy A56 5G isn't a bad phone, but you can do a lot better.
items.body: Samsungâ€™s Galaxy A series is one of the most popular affordable Android phone lines, and the Galaxy A56 5G is one of the latest entries. With a decent spec sheet, modern design, and $500 price tag, it should be an easy recommendation â€¦ right? As it turns out, itâ€™s not. In his Galaxy A56 5G review , my colleague Ryan Haines found that the phoneâ€™s mediocre performance, lack of wireless charging, and limited camera capabilities hold it back considerably. But above all, one of the A56â€™s most significant problems is that itâ€™s outdone by the competition.

items.title: Martinez edging closer to Villa career crossroads
items.summary: Emiliano Martinez is hailed as the world's best goalkeeper at Aston Villa home games - but even though his team are riding high, the Argentina international is at a crossroads.

items.title: New Galaxy S26 leak reveals a long-overdue storage upgrade for cheapest S26
items.summary: Samsung could finally catch up to rivals by ditching the 128GB model.
items.body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority TL;DR A Finnish retail leak has apparently revealed colors and storage models for the Samsung Galaxy S26 series. The listing corroborates a previous claim that the cheapest Galaxy S26 will now offer 256GB of storage instead of 128GB. This would be a long-overdue move as most of Samsungâ€™s rivals have offered 256GB of base storage for years now. Samsung is one of the few manufacturers still offering flagship Android phones with 128GB of storage, as seen on the base Galaxy S25. However, a new retail leak has revealed some good news for the Galaxy S26. SuomiMobiili reports (h/t: SammyGuru ) that an unnamed Finnish retailer has posted color and storage details for the Samsung Galaxy S26 range . The base Galaxy S26 will apparently be available in 256GB and 512GB flavors.

items.summary: MOTD pundit Danny Murphy explains how Manchester United earned their impressive win at Premier League leaders Arsenal, and how he feels the Gunners will react.

items.summary: Arsenal's winless run may normally be cause for concern - but the stats suggest they are still in control of the Premier League title race.

items.title: Wireless charging still annoys me, but one moment made it absolutely essential
items.summary: The universe loves to prove me wrong.
items.body: Whenever I get too comfortable, the universe has a way of bringing me back to reality. As I read my colleague Robâ€™s reasoning for always ensuring his phones support wireless charging , I realized he made a good point. For him, wireless charging is essential as a backup solution in the event that something happens to his phoneâ€™s charging port. But ultimately, I decided that wireless charging wasnâ€™t a necessary feature for me.

items.title: If thereâ€™s one thing I want from my next phone itâ€™s less AI in my camera
items.summary: AI won't save bad cameras from being bad.
items.body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority I wouldnâ€™t say Iâ€™m a photography purist (I shoot with a Fuji after all), but one thing that continues to draw me to using my mirrorless over all but the very best smartphone cameras is a more natural look to my pictures. Itâ€™s not that smartphones are bad by any stretch of the imagination; some smartphone cameras are absolutely brilliant. But take a closer look, and even the best handsets leave telltale signs of overprocessing; whether itâ€™s oversharpened skin textures from the Pixelâ€™s portrait mode or overly dark shadows in Appleâ€™s HDR algorithm.

items.title: You may soon be able to pay for ad-free WhatsApp
items.summary: WhatsApp may offer subscriptions to avoid ads in Status and Channels.
items.body: TL;DR WhatsApp started testing ads in Status and Channels last year. New strings in the app hint that Meta could introduce an ad-free subscription. Ad-free subscriptions are already available for Facebook and Instagram to some users. With as much division there is in the world right now, at least we can all agree on one thing: Ads suck. At best, we tolerate them, but the incessant push to introduce them to every last corner of our lives can be incredibly frustrating to endure â€” who ever thought theyâ€™d be getting ads on their kitchen fridge ? Sometimes, at least, we get the option to avoid ads (for a price), and now we may have spotted one of the next apps planning to introduce just such a program. NEWSLETTER | Authority Insights --> Authority Insights You're reading an Authority Insights story. Subscribe to our new Authority Insights newsletter for more exclusive reports, app teardowns, leaks, and in-depth tech coverage you won't find anywhere else. sign up now By signing up, you agree to our Terms of Use and acknowledge the data practices in our Privacy Policy. You may unsubscribe at any time. Last year, WhatsApp started testing ads for its Status and Channels views. And as youâ€™dâ€¦

items.title: I tested the Fairphone 6, and itâ€™s exactly the type of Android phone the US needs
items.summary: This is how smaller brands can really stand apart from Samsung and Apple.
items.body: Itâ€™s no secret that the North American smartphone market is far smaller than the rest of the world. I have a drawer full of Android phones Iâ€™ve purchased or reviewed over the years, but theyâ€™re all made by the same handful of companies. Apple and Samsung dominate the US smartphone industry, with Google and Motorola being the only other brands with significant market share. To be even remotely competitive with these giant players, small phone brands need to think outside the box. That means giving users something the big conglomerates canâ€™t. It could be a niche feature, novelty design, or clever value proposition.

items.title: 5 ways Video Boost keeps disappointing me on my Pixel 10 Pro
items.summary: Video Boost was supposed to solve the video problem on Pixels, but it remains slow, cumbersome, and unreliable.
items.body: Video Boost has been a staple of the Pixelâ€™s camera experience for two years now, helping us shoot clearer, more stable, better zoomed videos in challenging situations. For me, though, the feature hasnâ€™t always been part of my go-to tricks. I used it a lot when it first launched on the Pixel 8 Pro , then sort of forgot about it, then started using it again last summer. I fell in love with Video Boost again when I used it to catch a few videos during concerts. But for all that Iâ€™ve enjoyed about it, Iâ€™m just as annoyed by all of its limitations and slowness. Iâ€™d love to use Video Boost more on my Pixel 10 Pro XL , but itâ€™s clear that Google is gatekeeping the feature and stopping it from reaching its full potential.

items.title: Foldables are going mainstream in 2026. Hereâ€™s why Iâ€™m still not buying one
items.summary: I'm still not ready to buy into the foldable dream.
items.body: More than any previous year, 2026 is likely to be the biggest yet for foldable phones. Samsung is set to release the Galaxy Z TriFold, Motorola is launching its first book-style foldable with the Razr Fold, and â€” most importantly â€” Apple is expected to finally debut its long-awaited iPhone Fold. This is the big moment the foldable industry has been waiting for, and if you havenâ€™t bought a foldable yet , thereâ€™s a good chance 2026 will be the year that finally happens. At least for some people.

items.title: Google Driveâ€™s new â€˜Smartâ€™ AI features are forcing me to move all my private documents
items.summary: To something that doesn't force-feed me AI.
items.body: Credit: Tushar Mehta / Android Authority When Google started its operations in the late 1990s, it set out to â€œorganize the worldâ€™s information and make it universally accessible and useful.â€ Despite continual, and sometimes secretive, iteration, the clause remains intact in its mission statement. With the AI boom, Google wants to make information accessible without any significant effort, and is extending these principles beyond web search. Last month, it extended the same altruistic virtues to Google Drive, where you now see AI overview-style summaries for your folders . With this change, Googleâ€™s AI will look through your folders, any directories within them, the files stored in them, and even the contents of those files, so you can find whatever youâ€™re looking for immediately. These â€œsmartâ€ features in Google Drive are available to all paying Gemini subscribers and Workspace users. Google says it saves time and helps you discover files buried under several layers of folders. But Iâ€™m deeply unsettled by Google raking through my files â€” especially without my explicit consent â€” and the only solution I feel I have now is to stop trusting Google with anything private.

items.title: Grudge match or homecoming - what next for Pimblett?
items.summary: Paddy Pimblett is not short of options for his return to fighting despite his loss to Justin Gaethje at UFC 324.
